page.title: 08PONY TREKKING IN LYDFORD
page.content: Lydford Stables owns eleven horses and ponies.They have three horses on loan so Claire has fourteen horses. Claire feeds her horses on hay fed in haynets and for hard food the horses will have bran,sugar beet, oats and pony nuts.They have this in a bucket three times aday.The horses have new shoes every two months.For a set of four it costs twelve pounds. The horses vary in sizes. The smallest is 12h.h and Major is 16.3 h.h which is very large. The horses and ponies go out for about 3 hours on average every day. Claire,in the summer, can have about a hundred riders in a week. Most of the tack is bought in an out of town shopping centre.It is cheaper there so she can save money. At the end of the summer Claire will sell some of her horses and poniesw.
